abstracts.cdata!:
The Infrastructure Asset Management
            Project aims to improve air, road, and coastal transport
            infrastructure and to support public sector reform and
            increased private sector participation in the provision of
            infrastructure. The purpose of this environmental analysis
            is to identify and assess the environmental issues
            associated with the project and evaluate the need for
            further reviews. The airport improvement component may cause
            spillages from resurfacing materials resulting in pollution
            of groundwater and the lagoon ecosystem, which will be
            mitigated by adhering to proper procedures. Road subsector
            work may bring about dust and/or mud problems during
            construction. To mitigate such impact, codes of
            environmental practice will be observed. Under the coastal
            infrastructure component, groundwater flows to the coast may
            be inhibited, access to the coast may be curtailed, and
            lagoon ecosystem may be affected. Mitigation measures
            include designing coastal protection methods in consultation
            with the village concerned.
